channel.description: Recent content in Fish on raspberryPiSite

item.title: Do fish see water?
item.description: Fish are aquatic creatures that are surrounded by water their entire lives, but contrary to popular belief, they do not see water. Water is a transparent and colorless substance, which means that it is invisible to fish. As a result, fish do not have a concept of “water,” in the same way that humans don’t have a concept of “air.” To understand this, imagine a world where you lived in water but had no awareness of its existence.
